{"step_by_step_thinking": "Brain death is defined as the irreversible cessation of all functions of the entire brain, including the brain stem. Positive spinal reflexes on stimulation (option B) can also be seen in brain dead patients as these reflexes are mediated by the spinal cord, not the brain. Sweating and tachycardia (option C) are not signs of brain death as they are controlled by the autonomic nervous system, which is part of the brain.
